name: omni
author: Clarence Manuel <rencedm112@gmail.com>
about: omni is development workflow orchestration tool
long_about: Flexible task runner and scaffolding CLI for streamlined development workflows.

opts.help: Print traces to stdout
Output Error traces to stderr
The file to write traces to
The trace level to use for file traces
The file which marks the root dir where to stop looking for env files
The env files to load per directory
The environment to use
Inherit environment variables from the parent process

subcommands.name: get
subcommands.about: Retrieves the value of an environment variable

positionals.help: The name of the environment variable to retrieve

subcommands.name: exec
subcommands.about: Execute an ad-hoc command in projects

positionals.help: The arguments to pass to the task

opts.help: Filter the task/projects based on the meta configuration, accepts CEL syntax
Filter based on the project name matching the passed argument, accepts glob patterns
Filter based on projects residing in the specified directories, accepts glob patterns
How many concurrent tasks to run
Don't execute the task, just print the command to be executed
Output the results of the execution to the specified file
Output the results of the execution in the specified format, if not specified, the format will be inferred from the file extension
Ui mode to use while running the command
The base commit to compare against. This will implicitly enable --scm-affected
The target commit to compare against. This will implicitly enable --scm-affected
How many retries to do if the task fails before failing the whole execution, takes precedence over `max_retry` task configuration if specified
How long to wait before retrying a failed task, takes precedence over `retry_interval` task configuration if specified
Enable scm-based filtering of tasks. Optionally specify the scm to use for detecting affected tasks
Pretty print the schema
Which shell to generate completion for
Run the command without dependencies. Not compatible with --with-dependents
Run the task along with its dependents. Useful for combining with filters. Not compatible with --ignore-deps
How to handle failures
Don't save the execution result to the cache
Don't replay the logs of cached task executions
Force execution of tasks, even if it's already cached

Filter based on projects residing in the specified directories, accepts glob patterns

subcommands.name: hash
subcommands.author: Clarence Manuel <rencedm112@gmail.com>
subcommands.about: Get hash for workspace or projects

opts.help: Only output the raw string representation of the hash, no trailing newline, and no traces

subcommands.name: workspace
subcommands.about: Get the hash for the workspace

subcommands.name: project
subcommands.about: Get the hash for a project

opts.help: Hash specific task
Pretty print the schema
The format to use for the output
Filter the cache entries by project name, accepts glob patterns
Filter the cache entries by task name, accepts glob patterns
Add filter to clear only stale cache entries
Add filter to clear only stale cache entries
Add filter to clear only cache entries that are larger than the given size
Add filter to clear only cache entries belonging to a project that matches the given project name, accepts glob patterns
Add filter to clear only cache entries belonging to a task that matches the given task name, accepts glob patterns
Add filter to clear only cache entries of projects residing in the given directory, accepts glob patterns
Prune the cache without prompting for confirmation
Show the cache entries that would be deleted

The API key of the remote cache server
The tenant code of the remote cache server

The environment code of the remote cache server
